curam.util.cache
Class LeastRecentlyUsedCache<K,V>

java.lang.Object
  curam.util.cache.LeastRecentlyUsedCache<K,V>
Type Parameters:
K - Key.
V - Value.
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.Map<K,V>
public class LeastRecentlyUsedCache<K,V>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Map<K,V>

A simple hash map based least recently used (LRU) cache. If the maximum cache size is reduced this cache does not actively try to remove excess items from the cache. Items will only be purged when new items are written to the cache in accordance with the behavior of the linked hash map.

LeastRecentlyUsedCache

public LeastRecentlyUsedCache(int defaultCacheSize,
                              java.lang.String cacheSizePropertyName)
Cache constructor that allows the cache to be resized based on the value set in the specified configuration property.

Parameters:
defaultCacheSize - The default cache size, this can be overridden by a configuration property.
cacheSizePropertyName - The configuration property to check for the cache size.
